WjRadialGauge Class

Base Class
WjGauge
Module
wijmo.angular
File
wijmo.angular.js

AngularJS directive for the RadialGauge control.

Use the WjRadialGauge directive to add radial gauges to your AngularJS applications. Note that directive and parameter names must be formatted as lower-case with dashes instead of camel-case. For example:

Here is a <b>RadialGauge</b> control:</p>
<wj-radial-gauge
  style="height:300px" 
  value="count" 
  min="0" max="10"
  is-read-only="false">
</wj-radial-gauge>

The WjRadialGauge directive supports the following attributes:

control
= Reference to the RadialGauge control created by this directive.
autoScale
@ Whether the gauge should scale the display to fill the host element.
format
@ Format string used for displaying the gauge values as text.
hasShadow
@ Whether the gauge should display a shadow effect.
isAnimated
@ Whether the gauge should animate value changes.
isReadOnly
@ Whether users can edit the value using the mouse and keyboard.
min
@ Minimum value that can be displayed on the gauge.
max
@ Maximum value that can be displayed on the gauge.
showText
@ Determines which values should be displayed as text within the gauge.
step
@ Amount to add or subtract to the value property when the user presses the arrow keys.
startAngle
@ Starting angle for the gauge, measured clockwise from the 9 o'clock position.
sweepAngle
@ Sweeping angle for the gauge (may ne positive or negative).
thickness
@ Thickness of the gauge, on a scale between zero and one.
value
= The value displayed on the gauge.

The WjRadialGauge directive may contain one or more WjRange directives.
